text: Random though: make `.` a postfix-operator, so it's possible to write `f.` for `BroadcastFunction(f)`, which people have been asking for. Then make it accept unicode suffixes, so we can have `a.ᵀ` for `transpose(a)`. Would be right between the line of numpy's `a.T` and Matlab's `a.'`. Not sure it's maybe too confusing that this wouldn't just be `getproperty` and would also be slightly breaking for this reason. We also have a lot of dots with different meanings already, so maybe that would be too overloaded.
